subj-group.subject: So you think you have read this journal?

title-group.article-title: So you think you have read this journal?

permissions.copyright-holder: The British Society for Surgery of the Hand

body.p: 1. Approximately what proportion of distal radial fractures do not need reduction and can simply be placed in a plaster of Paris cast?
2. To what extent does skeletal displacement contribute to the final clinical outcome after Colles’ fracture?
3. The rate of operation for Colles’ fracture is almost the same as the rate of reduction and plaster of Paris. True or false?
4. What is the most common type of dorsal scapholunate ligament injury?
5. What are the two primary nutrient arteries supplying the medial femoral condyle?
6. Which quadrant of the medial femoral condyle has the highest number of perforating vessels?
7. Why is measurement of grip strength often applied in full elbow extension?
8. Why is test-retest reliability of grip strength measurement one of its most essential measurement properties?
9. What would be the clinical benefit of grip strength in full elbow extension?
10. By which mechanisms is it thought that axonal regeneration occurs after end-to-side neurorrhaphy?
11. When assessing nerve function after repair which test is thought to be one of the most discriminatory?
